requirements.text: RBC 1 If the Contractor intends to introduce new functions and/or propose improved solutions from the ones proposed in this document, these must be approved by CFR.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1780

requirements.text: RBC 2 This document is the basis for establishing the final version for CRS of the RBC.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1781

requirements.text: RBC 3 If several RBCs are to be installed, each of them must fulfil the following values. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1784

requirements.text: RBC 4 MTBSF. For a total failure, the MTBSF for the RBC (including interfaces to the electronic interlock installations and GSM-R) must be at least 760,000 hours. The tender must present relevant documents proving this value. Such documents must be made by independent bodies (e.g. EBA, Certifer, etc.).(O)
requirements.title: TND_1785

requirements.text: RBC 5 MTTR. For a total failure, the MTTR for the RBC (including interfaces to the electronic interlock installations and GSM-R) must be at most 340 minutes. The tender must present relevant documents proving this value. Such documents must be made by independent bodies (e.g. EBA, Certifer, etc.).(O)
requirements.title: TND_1786

requirements.text: RBC 6 The Tenderer must present the principles for the calculation of the MTBF and MTTR in their tender.(O)
requirements.title: TND_1787

requirements.text: RBC 7 The Tenderer must present in their tender how the RBC meets the above MTBF and MTTR values. (O)
requirements.title: TND_1788

requirements.text: RBC 8 Uptime. For the RBC (including the interfaces to the electronic interlock installations and GSM-R) at least 99.955% uptime must be ensured. The offer must present relevant documents proving this value. (O)
requirements.title: TND_1789

requirements.text: RBC 9 The above values must be valid for the entire useful life of the equipment (25 years).(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1793

requirements.text: RBC 10 SIL 4. The software and the hardware equipment must be designed in accordance with SIL 4, as described in the relevant CENELEC norms (EN 50126, EN 50128 and EN 50129). The offer must present relevant documents proving this value. Such documents must be prepared by independent bodies (e.g. EBA, Certifer, etc.).(O)
requirements.title: TND_1794

requirements.text: RBC 11 For the purposes of this document, “software and hardware equipment” shall mean the RBC including the interfaces to the electronic interlock installations and GSM-R.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1795

requirements.text: RBC 12 The tender for the RBC must be compliant with EN 50129, paragraph B4 “Operating with outside influences”. For B.4.6, the tenderer must submit their proposal.(O)
requirements.title: TND_1797

requirements.text: RBC 13 Environment-1. All the equipment must meet the relative humidity requirement: maximum 85% without condensation.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1798
TND_1799
TND_1802

requirements.text: RBC 16 RBC and the interfaces with the electronic interlock installations and GSM-R installations must be mounted inside containers. It is allowed to install ETCS equipment in the same container as the one for the electronic interlock installations or in the equipment building. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1812

requirements.text: RBC 17 The Tenderer must take into consideration that the outdoor equipment will be installed near the 27 kV / 50 Hz catenary.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1813

requirements.text: RBC 18 CEM. Electromagnetic compatibility must be ensured between the proposed solution and the existing trackside INDUSI system and with INDUSI 60/PZB 90, installed on the current engines. The Tenderer shall present documentary evidence to this effect. (O)
requirements.title: TND_1814

requirements.text: RBC 19 Solution maturity. The solution proposed for the ETCS RBC must be based at least on SRS 230d, in compliance with one of the specification sets 1, 2 or 3 of annex A2 to the Decision (EU) 2016/919, of the European Commission of 27 May 2016 (table A 2.1, table A 2.2, table A 2.3).(O)
requirements.title: TND_1815

requirements.text: RBC 20 RBC Capacity. RBC and GSM-R must be able to operate with at least 40 OBU located simultaneously in the area it controls. (O)
requirements.title: TND_1818

requirements.text: RBC 21 eLDA. Between RBC and the CTS exchange, an IP connection will be made for the eLDA.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1819

requirements.text: RBC 22 Between the RBC, CEs and MSCs, the GSM-R IP/MPLS transport network must be used. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1820

requirements.text: RBC 23 The RBC shall connect simultaneously in both MSCs. In case of failure of a MSC, RBC shall automatically switch, without any human intervention, within a maximum of 30 seconds, to the other MSC.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1821

requirements.text: RBC 24 To connect with the neighboring RBCs, the tenderer shall use UNISIG Subset 039.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1822

requirements.text: RBC 25 The CMI must be of the vital MMI type, similar with the requirements presented in the specifications for the CE installations regarding MMI. The CMI operation post must be redundant (hot reserve). The reserve post must contain the same number of monitors as the main one and provide identical operation facilities. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1826

requirements.text: RBC 26 CMI Playback. The hardware equipment and the related software shall be supplied as part of the tender, ensuring the playback facility for the CMI operation post - RBC. It shall be placed in the dedicated RBC maintenance location.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1827

requirements.text: RBC 27 The implementation of the graphic symbols for the CMI shall be done in compliance with the document Symbol Catalog version 1.3.2.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1828

requirements.text: RBC 28 Any indication for the controller must be displayed on the CMI.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1830

requirements.text: RBC 29 When an OBU enters the area of responsibility of the RBC, the RBC must send the train number received from the OBU to the CMI. The train number displayed on the CMI must be unique, both on the graphical representation and in the application that displays the alarms and in the list of trains registered with that RBC. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1831

requirements.text: RBC 30 If the train numbers are different, the CMI and the MMI/CMT must display an error message: “Train number error”.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1832

requirements.text: RBC 31 A check will be performed, with a warning message on the CMI, if 2 engine mechanics enter the same train number.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1833

requirements.text: RBC 32 It must be possible from the CMI to carry out the UES command for all modes specified in UNISIG to accept this command (SB, FS, SR, OS, UN, SE, SN), and for the ones that do not accept UES (NP, SH, SL, NL,TR, PT, SF, IS, RV), the command must be rejected from the start by the installation logic.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1834

requirements.text: RBC 33 REC: If the mechanic presses the REC button (Railway Emergency Call) on the cab radio, the Alarm window of the CMI must display a text message containing the operational number of the train that activated the REC, the date and time. This message must be accompanied by a sound signal. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1835

requirements.text:
RBC 34 Track configuration (LC)
The RBC must include a database containing information regarding the track configuration. The track configuration must consist at least of:
- Track sections (identification, length)
- Balises
- Turnouts
- ITN
- Declivities
- Static speed profiles for all categories of trains specified in OPE TSI „ ANNEX B - LIST OF ETCS OPERATIONAL TRAIN CATEGORIES”
- Static speed profiles for the turnout outside position.
- Areas where MA termination is not allowed or areas where trains are not allowed to stop
- Features of the catenary
- Maximum load per axle of the track
- Kilometric positions
- National values
- Temporary speed restrictions
- Whistle indicators
- Neutral zones of the catenary (indicating: “decouple the breaker”)
- Metallic bridges and any other large metal masses
- Position of the stopping lines on the current track and of stations
- Areas where the engine mechanic must disable the magnetic brake, the “EDDY” electromagnetic brake and the regenerative brake
- Areas where the mechanic must switch the air conditioning to recirculation.
It is the duty of the Contractor to properly enter all the above data in the RBC software and obtain all technical information needed for a complete configuration of the track.
The Contractor has the obligation to provide the members of the CFR Technical Verification Panel in table form all the configuration data entered in the RBC software, according to requirementbookmark15
requirements.title: TND_1837

requirements.text: RBC 35 RBC must perform ITN information management.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1860

requirements.text:
RBC 36 Operational data (LC)
The RBC must dynamically use a set of operational data. The operational data must consist at least of:
- The last position received from all recorded trains
- The last speed received from all recorded trains
- The mode in which the trains run
- Other data received by the train
It must be possible to display such data on the CMI.
requirements.title: TND_1861

requirements.text: RBC 37 On startup, the RBC must check its configuration and run a self-test program.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1868

requirements.text: RBC 38 Any fault that could lead to degraded operation of the RBC must be reported to the controller. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1869

requirements.text: RBC 39 The diagnostic system must recognize the fault conditions of the RBC system and of the interfaces with the other systems (CE, OBU, GSM-R).(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1870

requirements.text:
RBC 40 TSR after system restart
In case of a fault in the system and a restart of the system, the RBC must keep/store all the temporary speed restrictions. Speed restrictions must be kept even on complete power loss on the RBC equipment. Deleting them is only allowed when replacing the RBC system software. After a fault followed by a restart, the RBC must show the controller for confirmation all the temporary speed restrictions that had been stored until the procedure is completed by the controller, the RBC must not be able to issue MAs to the trains in its area. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1871

requirements.text:
RBC 41 Last stored conditions
RBC must keep stored and be able to display on the CMI on startup the specific data (track configuration) or other data, if applicable. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1873

requirements.text:
RBC 42 After restart-1(LC)
After a restart, the RBC must determine:
- Train position (after the OBU receiving position reports)
- The state of the objects (from interlock installations)
requirements.title: TND_1875

requirements.text:
RBC 43 After restart-2(LC)
After restarting the RBC, it must request each OBU that still has a communication session open with it to close the session and initiate a new “start of mission”.
requirements.title: TND_1879

requirements.text:
RBC 44 After restart-3(LC)
When the RBC is ready to operate safely after the restart, it must report to the controller and the maintenance personnel.
requirements.title: TND_1881

requirements.text: RBC 45 A valid position must be obtain after the engine passes by any group of balises in the RBC area. The OBU - RBC system must be able to recognize a valid position, as it has been previously defined. This requirement applies for all situations, not only “after restart”. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1883

requirements.text: RBC 46 The RBC must be aware of the balise groups in its area and the ones in the related announcement/transition zones.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1884

requirements.text: RBC 47 The RBC must always be able to determine whether a reported position corresponds to its own area or not.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1885

requirements.text: RBC 48 The RBC must be able to transmit to the appropriate train any change that occurs in the CE installation that affects that train, for instance by issuing message for conditional/unconditional emergency stop when the conditions for train movement are no longer met. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1886

requirements.text: RBC 49 When the RBC has recorded the train number, it must be shown on the controller’s screen so that the controller may easily identify the last section occupied by the train. The indication must rely on the information received from the OBU.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1887

requirements.text: RBC 50 Announcement/transition zones must be shown on the CMI.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1888

requirements.text: RBC 51 The start and end conditions (display / clear) for individual text messages on the DMI shall be specified as design data and shall be approved by the Client. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1889

requirements.text: RBC 52 The system reaction to problems related to linking between two consecutive groups of missing/malfunctioning balises along the track must be “service brake”. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1890

requirements.text: RBC 53 The RBC must accept/record the train even if the reported position is invalid or unknown. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1892

requirements.text: RBC 54 When a train has been recorded with an invalid/unknown position, the RBC must not issue a movement authority for that train unless it is in the “Staff Responsible” mode.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1893

requirements.text: RBC 55 As soon as a report is received from the train on a valid position, the train and its number must be shown in the relevant positions on the CMI.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1894

requirements.text: RBC 56 If the train is accepted by the RBC, the recording must be done according to the document “TSI CCS Annex A”.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1895

requirements.text: RBC 57 The RBC must not accept/record a train if the valid position that was reported shows that the OBU is not in its own area or in the approach/transition zones. A message shall be sent to the train on the cancellation (from the RBC viewpoint) and the communication session shall be closed. See also the definitions at paragraph 5.4.2.1, SUBSET 026.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1897

requirements.text: RBC 58 A train that was manually recorded in the RBC outside the controlled area must not be disconnected when entering the area of that RBC.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1898

requirements.text: RBC 59 The train must not be slowed due to a level transition.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1900

requirements.text: RBC 60 At CFR the entry point in a level 2 zone must be a traffic signal. The announcement/transition zone must be the section before this signal.(LC).
requirements.title: TND_1901

requirements.text: RBC 61 When designing the RBC, it shall be taken into account that supervised areas need to be provided for at the ends which ensure the issue of movement authorities according to the requirements in this document. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1902

requirements.text: RBC 62 It must be taken into account that the necessary information when leaving the supervised areas shall be taken from systems that are implemented outside the project. Supervised areas are areas that are adjacent to the area controlled by the RBC, from which the ETCS system must gather the information to perform entry/exit transitions.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1903

requirements.text: RBC 63 The border between level 0/STM and level 2 must be a traffic signal, as shown in the figure. The level change must be done after this signal. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1906

requirements.text: RBC 64 The transition procedure must be as presented in the document “TSI CCS Annex A ” plus the requirements in this document. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1908

requirements.text: RBC 65 The RBC must not send the same Movement Authority to 2 successive trains running from the level 0/STM area to the level 2 area. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1909

requirements.text: RBC 66 Trains that enter areas that are not controlled by the RBC (level 0/1/STM) must be automatically recorded, without requiring the train to brake for this purpose.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1910

requirements.text: RBC 67 Even if a route is not set for the train, the transition must be announced by the announcement balise group (LTA), but in this case no MA shall be issued for the train.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1911

requirements.text: RBC 68 The border between level 1 and level 2 must be a traffic signal.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1914

requirements.text: RBC 69 Border signals shall be connected both at ETCS level 1 (LEU) and at ETCS level 2 (RBC), through the CE installation.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1915

requirements.text: RBC 70 If the border signal is a block signal set on stop due to a reason for which the RBC could issue the MA (burnt out lamps, faulty ITN, occupied section, etc.), the RBC must issue such MA, which will become active when the transition is performed. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1916

requirements.text: RBC 71 It is allowable to have the ETCS level 1 system issue an MA over the ETCS level 2 area, for the purpose of preventing a reduction in speed / braking of the OBU due to the level transition. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1917

requirements.text:
RBC 72 In any situation, after making the transition, the following are required:
- reduction by the RBC of the MA given by the ETCS level 1 system OR
- introduction of a TSR on the existing MA, which must occur immediately. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1918

requirements.text: RBC 73 If the following condition cannot be fulfilled due to a lack of communication of the OBU with the RBC, the functionality for T_NVCONTACT must be triggered. See also the chapter „TNVCONTACT’ (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1921

requirements.text: RBC 74 The requirements are the same as presented in the chapter “Automatic transition from level 0/STM to level 2”.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1922

requirements.text: RBC 75 The border between level 2 and level 0/STM must be a traffic signal, as shown in the figure. The level change must occur before this signal, so that the train may go over the signal in the INDUSI mode and the mechanic be able to see and comply with the signal indications. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1924

requirements.text: RBC 76 The transition procedure must be the one presented in the document “TSI CCS Annex A document ” plus the requirements in this document.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1927

requirements.text: RBC 77 The transition to level 0/STM must be done before the signal, according to the following drawing, so that the train may go over the signal with INDUSI enabled. The issued MA must have length until the next signal, over the limits of the level 2 areas, but will disappear (will be cancelled in the OBU) at the time of transition to level 0. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1928

requirements.text: RBC 78 In order to comply with chapter 1.1 of the “Instruction for Train Speed Control and Auto-stop - Trackside Equipment”, ed. 1972, the speed V_LOA when exiting a level shall be in accordance with the indication of the first signal after leaving ETCS level 2, as follows:
requirements.title: TND_1929

requirements.text: RBC 79 The MA must be issued beyond the limits of the level 2 area so that the train is able to pass the signal without any speed restriction. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1941

requirements.text: RBC 80 The details on the location of the balises for the exit of the OBU from level 2 to level 0/STM shall be detailed as design data for each individual case. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1942

requirements.text: RBC 81 The border between level 2 and level 1 must be a traffic signal. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1944

requirements.text: RBC 82 Border signals shall be connected both to ETCS level 1(LEU) and to ETCS level 2 (RBC), through the CE installation.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1945

requirements.text: RBC 83 If the border signal is on stop (regardless of whether it is a station signal or a block signal), the MA shall end at this signal. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1946

requirements.text: RBC 84 If the border signal shows a permissive indication, then the MA shall not stop at this signal. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1947

requirements.text: RBC 85 The telegram announcing the level transition (including the position where the transition will occur) must be issued by the RBC and the balise group that announces the transition (LTA-BG).(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1948

requirements.text: RBC 86 The transition (made at the latest at the LT-BG) shall be made before the border signal. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1949

requirements.text: RBC 87 The engine mechanic must have the possibility to connect to the RBC manually outside the area controlled by it. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1951

requirements.text: RBC 88 The value for the variable T_NVCONTACT is set every 15 seconds, and the reaction, indicated by the variable M_NVCONTACT, is “service brake”. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1953

requirements.text: RBC 89 The value for the variable T_NVCONTACT shall be recorded both in the balises that announce the transition to level 2 (LTA-BG) and in the balises for transition to level 2 (LT-BG).(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1954

requirements.text: RBC 90 Recovery: The RBC shall be connected to both MSCs (Bucharest & Ploiesti), in order to operate under load-sharing, i.e. if a MSC fails the ETCS services must switch to the other MSC, without human intervention, in less than 30 seconds. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1955

requirements.text: RBC 91 The train must not be slowed due to a handover between the 2 RBCs.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1957

requirements.text: RBC 92 The border between 2 RBCs must be a traffic signal. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1958

requirements.text: RBC 93 Block signals are installed at CFR 2 on a mast, back to back. If the border between 2 RBCs consists of block signals, one of such signals shall be the border for the first level 2 area and the second one for the second area.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1959

requirements.text:
RBC 94 The offered system must (O):
- be in commercial operation in a railway administration in the European Union or Switzerland.
- in the implementation presented at the previous point, the offered RBC must perform the HANDOVER function with a RBC manufactured by another supplier, according to the European requirements specified in subset 039 version 2.3.0 or later.
requirements.title: TND_1960

requirements.text: RBC 95 The RBC must ensure that the allocation of the train position to a location and line is correct and updated before issuing a MA.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1965

requirements.text: RBC 96 The parameters for the OBU requesting a new MA must be given by the RBC. T_MAR = 20 sec.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1966

requirements.text: RBC 97 In the station, it must not be allowed that the OBU have a MA without it being mirrored in a route that is locked in the electronic interlock installation. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1967

requirements.text: RBC 98 In case of a MA from the OBU (with the corresponding route locked), for which the CE installation announces the RBC that the train is no longer permitted to enter the route, the RBC must immediately revoke the MA, with the new EoA at the signal that had authorized the route. The RBC must ensure by requesting confirmation from the OBU, that the shortened MA is being used by the OBU.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1968

requirements.text: RBC 99 The withdrawal of an MA (from the OBU) must be done by the RBC through an emergency stop message sent by the RBC. When receiving an emergency stop message, the OBU confirms whether the MA revocation has been carried out. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1973

requirements.text: RBC 100 Sending an emergency stop message as an independent command initiated by the controller for a certain train shall be implemented. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1974

requirements.text: RBC 101 It must be possible to stop all trains in a certain area (not smaller than a station or a current line between 2 stations), by means of a single command carried out in the electronic interlock installation. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1975

requirements.text: RBC 102 Conditional emergency stop shall be used for CFR.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1976

requirements.text:
RBC 103 The RBC must never issue an MA for an OBU if any of the following elements is missing (LC):
- 	request for an MA from the OBU
-	route set in the CE installation
-	known ETCS level (the RBC must know at what level the OBU is running)
-	position report from the OBU
-	running direction (if the OBU is not in the RBC’s own area, but in the approach zone).
requirements.title: TND_1978

requirements.text: RBC 104 The length of an MA shall be given in compliance with the indications of the signals/route settings in the CE installation.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1984

requirements.text: RBC 105 Because the project line is a conventional line with signals, the length of the new MA must be dependent on route lengths. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1985

requirements.text: RBC 106 Under normal conditions (FS or OS, with no braking reaction from the system), an MA must always end 20m before a traffic signal, measured from the signal to the front end on the engine. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1986

requirements.text: RBC 107 The MA EoA shall always be a traffic signal; the MA shall never end at maneuver signals.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1987

requirements.text: RBC 108 The speed indication on the DMI shall always take precedence over any speed indications of the traffic signals.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1988

requirements.text:
RBC 109 The length of any MA issued by the RBC shall be determined according to the following rules (LC):
a)	No more than 6 block sectors
b)	A maximum of 6600 m.
requirements.title: TND_1989

requirements.text: RBC 110 To determine the length of the MA under the requirement bookmark45 the RBC shall start from the value 0, and then add sections until one of the two conditions is met (reaching either 6 sectors or the length of 6,600m).(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1992

requirements.text: RBC 111 Based on the routes made in the electronic interlock installation and the previous rule, the RBC must establish the MA with a certain length and send it to the OBU.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1993

requirements.text: RBC 112 To indicate the time when the OBU must request a new MA / MA extension, package 57 shall be sent to the OBU once. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1994

requirements.text: RBC 113 The point where the OBU must request a new MA (extension of the current MA) must be before the point where the OBU should start to brake, in compliance with the MRSP (Most Restrictive Speed Profile). The time between the two points is T_MAR=20 seconds. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1995

requirements.text: RBC 114 After starting to request a new MA, the OBU must continue to request it until it receives one. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_1996

requirements.text: RBC 115 When it receives a request from an MA from a train, the RBC must request the CE installation to prepare a route for that train.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_1997

requirements.text: RBC 116 The route setting request shall stop being displayed on the MMI (LC):
requirements.title: TND_1998

requirements.text: RBC 117 The request must be done by blinking the signal label on the MMI screen (of the IDM).(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2004

requirements.text: RBC 118 If the route has been set before, the RBC does not need to issue a new MA if the OBU has not already requested an MA.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2007

requirements.text: RBC 119 When the RBC receives a request: if the route is already set, the MA shall be issued immediately, without any additional request to the CE installation. If the route is not set (it is not possible to issue an MA), the RBC must send a request to the CE installation to set a route. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2009

requirements.text: RBC 120 The request for an MA (and whether it was resolved or not) must be displayed on the CMI. The display at the CMI-RBC post of the MA request originating from the engine must be done by changing the background of the train number from the current color (white or red) to yellow, for 3 seconds for each MA request that is received. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2010

requirements.text: RBC 121 The CMI must display the length of each MA. The MA must displayed at all times. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2011

requirements.text: RBC 122 The MA set over a section with turnouts (in a station) must take into consideration all the static speed profiles (SSP) for the deviated positions of the turnouts (lower values for speed compared to direct speed). (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2012

requirements.text: RBC 123 Issuing an MA over a stop signal: if the signal gives the indication “permissive stop” or is an “absolute stop” signal and shows the indication “call on locked route”, which involves a locked route covered by the signal, the RBC must issue an appropriate MA. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2013

requirements.text: RBC 124 Depending on the situation, the MA over a signal that shows the indication STOP may be FS or OS. The issue of this MA must be done in compliance with paragraph5.2.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2014

requirements.text: RBC 125 If more than one motor vehicle (OBU) is located on a section and a route is executed by the CE installation, the RBC must be able to send the MA to the appropriate OBU, based on the position report of the OBU on the track.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2016

requirements.text: RBC 126 The RBC shall never issue an MA that is not consistent with the train direction. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2017

requirements.text: RBC 127 It is not acceptable in any situation that a train should have an MA over an unlocked route/ part of a route.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2019

requirements.text: RBC 128 A change in the indication of a signal from “permissive” to “STOP” must generate the issue of a new updated MA from the RBC.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2020

requirements.text: RBC 129 If the OBU has passed a signal (that had a permissive indication) and a turnout or a level crossing installation from the rest of the locked route (previously authorized by that signal) loses control / detection, the RBC must send the UES (for the turnout over which the train will pass/ the level crossing installation).(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2021

requirements.text: RBC 130 The reaction of the system must be to trip only if losing control/detection for the element takes place “in front of the train”. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2023

requirements.text: RBC 131 For this function, the turnouts in the sliding path or the ones covering it and the level crossing installations in the sliding paths of the routes shall not be taken into consideration. Also, after the train passes the start signal of the route, any non-sequential occupancy of the route sections or loss of control/detection on the turnouts covering the routes shall not be taken into consideration. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2024

requirements.text: RBC 132 Upon failure of the Level Crossing Installation, a text message without confirmation shall be issued: “Faulty level crossing km.xxx+yyy”.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2025

requirements.text: RBC 133 For the case with a turnout in the parking position, the following functional requirements shall be considered for the configuration of the RBC / CE: (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2030

requirements.text: RBC 134 If the link between RBC and the CE installation is missing, the RBC must enable the UES for all trains (also for SB and SR modes with a valid position) in the coverage area of the Electronic Interlock. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2043

requirements.text: RBC 135 The RBC shall deemed that the link with the CE has failed if the duration of the interruption in the connection exceeds 5 seconds.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2044

requirements.text: RBC 136 The RBC shall not issue an MA for any signal in the station or the block.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2045

requirements.text: RBC 137 The loss of the link between CE and RBC must be signaled both on the CMI and on the MMI.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2046

requirements.text: RBC 138 If the RBC and the CE installation are not aligned in time, the RBC must not send MA to any OBU. A misalignment is deemed to be any time difference that is greater than or equal to 5 seconds. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2050

requirements.text: RBC 139 The system must ensure the synchronization of the time displayed on the human machine interface at CE and RBC (MMI and CMI).(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2051

requirements.text: RBC 140 For the case in which the RBC and the CE installation are not aligned in time, a procedure must be provided for the alignment.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2052

requirements.text: RBC 141 Each communication with each OBU shall be considered individually. The CMI shall display an alarm message upon losing communication between the OBU and the RBC.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2053

requirements.text: RBC 142 If communication is down, the RBC must consider the communication reestablished when it receives a new position report from the OBU.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2054

requirements.text: RBC 143 When communication with the OBU is reestablished, the RBC must send a new MA only if new elements appear (if the OBU has already requested an extension of the MA and a new route has been made in the interlock installation). (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2055

requirements.text: RBC 144 When all the requirements are met for train running (known location of the train, set and locked route), the RBC must issue an MA in the Full Supervision (FS) mode.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2058

requirements.text: RBC 145 The conditions for MA FS must be supervised at all times.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2059

requirements.text: RBC 146 The RBC must intervene with appropriate action, when applicable, for instance by issuing an emergency stop message, when the conditions for train running are no longer met. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2060

requirements.text: RBC 147 The OS MA must be issued by the RBC only if the train position and movement direction are known and the route is set and locked. Additionally, the train must be in its own area or the announcement/transition one. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2062

requirements.text: RBC 149 The distance from which the mechanic must have the OS window activated must be 200 m before the signal (in the station or on a block).(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2064

requirements.text: RBC 150 The confirmation for OS MA must be requested from the mechanic regardless of the mode in which the OBU is when receiving the OS MA (the OBU may be in FS, OS or SR when it receives the OS MA).(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2065

requirements.text: RBC 151 If the mechanic fails to confirm after 5 seconds the transition to the OS mode from the current mode, the train shall receive the reaction “service brake” (SB), regardless of the train’s running speed. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2066

requirements.text: RBC 152 If the mechanic has confirmed the message for the transition to OS but the train has not passed the respective block/station signal with its front end and in the meantime the message switches the indication to permissive (as conditions have arisen to switch the mode to FS), the engine must receive the mode transition to FS, without being forced to needlessly run a block sector/a station route with reduced 20km/h speed, similar to a train that is not fitted with ETCS.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2067

requirements.text: RBC 153 The distance indicated for the Staff Responsible (SR) mode must be a national value. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2069

requirements.text: RBC 154 The RBC must display to the controller, through the CMI, the fact that the OBU is running in SR mode.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2070

requirements.text: RBC 156 All traffic signals shall be fitted with a balise group „STOP if in SR” (STOP if the OBU is in SR mode). For back-to-back signals, the same balise group shall be used for both directions. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2073

requirements.text:
RBC 157 The conditions for the issue of the TAF by the RBC are(LC):
-	the OBU has a valid position
-	the RBC can validate the position
-	the RBC is able to send an MA (FS or OS)
-	the OBU is in one of the following modes: SB, OS or SR
-	the OBU has not passed the signal with its front end.
requirements.title: TND_2075

requirements.text: RBC 158 The RBC shall issue the TAF request, which shall be displayed on the DMI when the OBU is in the TAF window (starting 200 m to the station or block signal). At the same distance, a group of balises shall be placed, consisting of 2 balises. The same group of balises shall also perform the function to reset the errors accumulated in the system onboard the engine. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2081

requirements.text: RBC 159 When the TAF is confirmed by the mechanic, the RBC shall issue an MA to the signal, followed by an MA issued in compliance with the signal indication / state. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2082

requirements.text: RBC 160 If there are two OBUs on the same section in the 200m TAF window, both having a valid position, the RBC shall only send the TAF to the first OBU in front of the referred signal. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2083

requirements.text: RBC 161 The controller must be able to enter and cancel a TSR by means of the CMI. The CMI must display the date, time and name of the operator that entered/cancelled a speed restriction. A log shall be generated in the CMI which shall include the above required information, which shall be protected against alteration/deletion by creating a special administrator account for legal data.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2085

requirements.text: RBC 162 The minimum number of TSRs active at the same time, entered by the RBC operator through the CMI, must be at least equal to the total number of elements that are individually defined in the software for which TSRs can be entered (sections with/without a turnout), in the area controlled by that RBC.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2086

requirements.text: RBC 163 For effective use during hot periods, a function shall be implemented in the CMI- RBC allowing the operator to enter multiple TSRs with the same value, selecting the start and the end of the affected area, without requiring individual selection of all included software components. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2087

requirements.text: RBC 164 It is allowed to enter a TSR even if MAs are set for that area or even if there are occupied sections in that area. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2088

requirements.text:
RBC 165 For a TSR, it must be possible to specify at least (LC):
-	maximum speed value
-	TSR limits (start/end)
-	text messages associated with the TSR (automatically sending a text message with the TSR, informing the mechanic). The text message shall be: “Speed restriction”. This shall be sent when the OBU is 1,000 m from the TSR. This is a message without acknowledgement.
requirements.title: TND_2089

requirements.text: RBC 166 The RBC must check and validate the TSR that was entered by the controller (for plausibility. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2093

requirements.text: RBC 167 Entering/removing a TSR must be considered immediately by the system. Such entering/removal must be immediately sent to the OBU (existing MAs must updated). (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2094

requirements.text:
RBC 168 It must be possible to define the limits of the TSR (LC)
-	either by identifying the track section without a turnout or the turnout
-	or by position on the track (every 5 m).
requirements.title: TND_2095

requirements.text: RBC 169 The RBC must allow the revocation (cancellation) of a TSR by the controller. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2098

requirements.text: RBC 170 It must be possible to enter/enable and cancel each TSR individually. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2099

requirements.text: RBC 171 It must be possible to enter a TSR with a 5km/h resolution, from 5km/h to 155km/h.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2100

requirements.text: RBC 172 It must be possible to overlap TSRs.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2101

requirements.text: RBC 173 Each TSR must be displayed distinctly on the CMI. Upon request from the Controller, its geographical limits shall be displayed on the schematic plan on the CMI.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2102

requirements.text: RBC 174 If 2 or more TSR overlap on a section, the CMI shall display the lowest one, according to the manner of presentation of the TSR.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2103

requirements.text: RBC 175 If 2 or more TSR overlap, the cancellation of one of the restrictions must not lead to any other TSR being cancelled.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2104

requirements.text: RBC 176 The speed corresponding to the TSR must be indicated upon request from the controller. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2105

requirements.text: RBC 177 In case of reset/loss of power to the RBC, the recorded TSRs must not be deleted or lost. The only case when it is accepted to lose entered TSRs is when changing the RBC software.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2106

requirements.text: RBC 178 The manner in which the TSRs are defined and displayed shall be in compliance with the document Symbol Catalog version 1.3.2. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2107

requirements.text: RBC 179 For an OBU in SR mode, the TSR must always be sent if the OBU is on the track block. In stations, the TSR shall only be sent by association with an MA.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2108

requirements.text:
RBC 180 The TSR must be given correctly and be real, under traffic safe conditions. The constructor must match the special km and the real ones. All data required for this matching are in the responsibility of the Constructor. Special Km are displayed on sign plates on the poles along the track, used by the track personnel to communicate speed restrictions. Real Km are as measured by the Contractor in the topo measurement, according to requirement GEN 69 and entered in the RBC design data.
“Matching special and real km” specified in this requirement means implementing a software function that allows the CMI operator to enter the speed restriction in the form shown in the field (special km), which shall be automatically converted by the RBC software to real km, which shall be used in the entered speed restriction.
The Contractor shall make available to the Client’s Technical Verification Panel in form of a table the matching between real and special km for the entire area of the RBC.
The Tenderer shall present how this matching will be made and shall stipulate all the costs for this in the tender. (O)
requirements.title: TND_2109

requirements.text: RBC 181 When it receives from the CE installation information regarding “Faulty ITN”, the RBC must immediately issue an MA with EoA at 50 m from the closest end of the level crossing. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2114

requirements.text: RBC 182 If the train is less than 50m from the closest end of the level crossing in the running direction, the RBC shall send the order to immediately apply the emergency brake (UES).(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2115

requirements.text: RBC 183 The DMI shall display a single text message without acknowledgement “Faulty level crossing, km.xxx+yyy" (where xxx+yyy are the kilometric position of the level crossing in the signaling schematic), as follows:
requirements.title: TND_2116

requirements.text: RBC 184 The distance from which the mechanic must be able to give confirmation on the DMI regarding the transition from the current running mode to OS mode shall be 250m from the nearest end of the level crossing, in the running direction.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2120

requirements.text: RBC 185 The length of the train running area in OS mode, over the faulty level crossing, shall be defined as follows: 50m from the nearest end of the level crossing plus the width of the crossing plus 50m after the level crossing.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2121

requirements.text: RBC 186 After the train passes with its front end the running area in OS mode, the mode shall automatically transition to FS (if the train was before in FS mode before the faulty level crossing and the conditions are met to change the current mode). If the OBU was in SR/OS mode before the faulty level crossing, the OBU shall keep the running mode until the next traffic signal. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2122

requirements.text: RBC 187 If the reason for which the level crossing was deemed faulty disappears (LC):
requirements.title: TND_2124

requirements.text: RBC 188 The “End of mission” procedure must be performed in compliance with the document “TSI CCS Annex A” plus the requirements in this document. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2130

requirements.text: RBC 189 The number of the train and the data regarding the train must be removed from the controller’s monitor when the de-recording is complete. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2131

requirements.text: RBC 190 Shunting movements are not performed under RBC control.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2133

requirements.text: RBC 191 The OBU must not be able to leave the station while in shunting (SH) mode.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2135

requirements.text: RBC 192 Balises at the entry signal in stations must contain the information “STOP if in SH", in the exit direction, in order to prohibit the train in SH mode which has no longer a connection with the RBC from leaving the station. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2136

requirements.text: RBC 193 The RBC must send the permission to make maneuvers to an OBU when it receives a request from it, only if the OBU has a valid position and is inside the station. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2137

requirements.text: RBC 194 No list of balises shall be sent to the OBU.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2138

requirements.text: RBC 195 Permanent shunting areas shall be used, defined inside the stations. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2140

requirements.text: RBC 196 The RBC must allow shunting inside stations from ETCS-equipped tracks (included in the RBC) to tracks that are not equipped with ETCS (not included in the RBC).(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2141

requirements.text: RBC 197 The shunting mode must be accepted by the RBC independently on whether the shunting signal in front of the train is set to free or not, and in areas inside the station that are not fitted with shunting signals. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2142

requirements.text: RBC 198 Shunting routes need not be recorded in the RBC.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2145

requirements.text: RBC 199 The OBU must be allowed to enter SH mode only when it (the OBU) is not moving. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2146

requirements.text: RBC 200 Neutral zones must be indicated in the track configuration.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2149

requirements.text: RBC 201 The RBC must send the OBU an indication of the places where the mechanic must close/open the circuit breaker.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2150

requirements.text: RBC 202 The issued MAs must take the following into account (LC):
requirements.title: TND_2151

requirements.text: RBC 203 The RBC must be able to memorize the text messages sent to the OBUs under its responsibility (its own area).(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2159

requirements.text: RBC 204 Only text messages received from the time when the OBU is recorded in the respective RBC shall be considered. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2160

requirements.text: RBC 205 The Tenderer shall provide to the Client, as part of the tender, an instrument for the real-time reading of telegrams sent/received between the RBC and each recorded OBU. The instrument must be able to automatically store the received telegrams for at least 1 month. The instrument shall be available starting with the CFR test period and shall then remain property of CFR.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2161

requirements.text: RBC 206 The RBC must be able to operate with fixed block lengths / track sections for train separation.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2163

requirements.text: RBC 207 For the indication to run on the left track of the double line fitted with trivialized BLA / BLAI, the RBC shall issue a text message with acknowledgment. The text is “Exit left”. If the mechanic does not acknowledge the message, a service brake shall be generated.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2164

requirements.text: RBC 208 For the direction indicator, the RBC shall issue a text message without acknowledgment. The text is “Direction” followed by the name of the station. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2165

requirements.text: RBC 209 2 static speed profiles are defined as function of the 2 categories of trains: (I)
requirements.title: TND_2166

requirements.text: RBC 210 The Contractor shall place in the field, in the necessary locations, the signs for entering/leaving the ETCS level 2. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2169

requirements.text: RBC 211 The RBC must be able to send an emergency stop message (conditional and unconditional) to the OBU, based on the status of the routes/information in the CE installation.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2172

requirements.text: RBC 212 The issue of an emergency stop message must be possible at any time. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2173

requirements.text: RBC 213 The RBC must send an emergency stop message to an OBU until it receives acknowledgement from the OBU. The acknowledgment refers to the fact that the message has reached the OBU, not that the mechanic has acknowledged the message.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2174

requirements.text: RBC 214 The emergency stop message must be revoked for the RBC to be able to issue a new MA to that OBU. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2175

requirements.text: RBC 215 The consequences (mode change, MA shortening) of each emergency stop message for each OBU must be shown on the CMI.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2176

requirements.text: RBC 216 The RBC must support security key management. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2178

requirements.text: RBC 217 The RBC must ensure that keys are kept securely and confidentially. It must be impossible to retrieve the secret keys installed in the RBC (for unauthorized persons).(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2179

requirements.text: RBC 218 The RBC must ensure the use of transport keys for the protection of the authentication keys (KMAC).(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2180

requirements.text: RBC 219 The generation and management of the keys must be according to UNISIG subset 038 and 114.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2181

requirements.text: RBC 220 The RBC must be able to store up to 5000 KMAC keys.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2182

requirements.text: RBC 221 The RBC must ensure secure procedures for the installation of transport keys. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2183

requirements.text: RBC 222 The RBC must ensure the installation and deletion of keys without interrupting their operation (for instance, without restarting or rebooting the RBC).(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2184

requirements.text: RBC 223 Keys stored in the RBC must not be lost in case of a loss of power or when changing the RBC software.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2185

requirements.text: RBC 224 The RBC must allow for different key management policies (for instance all trains/one train - one key). (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2186

requirements.text: RBC 225 Session keys generated by the RBC must be cryptographically strong, as specified in the UNISIG documents.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2187

requirements.text: RBC 226 The hardware and software equipment for key generation and management must be included in the tender, so that the Customer does not have to purchase additional equipment/software. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2188

requirements.text: RBC 227 The RBC must issue a new MA FS, practically identical with the previous one, but containing additionally a text message that indicates to the mechanic that they have permission to go over the signal that gives the stop indication due to burnt lamps on permissive lights. It is also accepted to only send a text message to the OBU (as described above) without issuing a new MA. The text message shall be displayed on the DMI at 600 m (if the lamps were burnt before) or nearer (if the lamps burn out when the train is at less than 600 m distance) from the signal and shall be without acknowledgment. The message shall be “Defective Signal”. The message shall disappear from the DMI when the OBU passes the signal with its front end. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2203

requirements.text: RBC 228 The conditions regarding the RBC’s reaction to a faulty level crossing on the block have been mentioned at chapter 3.9(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2205

requirements.text: RBC 229 The TCAF function in the CE installation is a function that is enabled on EACH TRACK, independently. In this respect, it should be taken into account that it is possible from the RBC’s viewpoint that the crossing may be considered faulty on one track (the one with TCAF activated) while on the other track the same level crossing would be deemed fully functional. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2207

requirements.text: RBC 230 In predefined locations (200 m in front of the signal), the RBC must send a TAF request to the OBU that is in OS or SR mode.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2209

requirements.text: RBC 231 If IDM has switched the block signal to stop, the RBC shall not issue an MA. The signal shall be overridden with OVERRIDE. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2211

requirements.text: RBC 232 If a block signal is on stop due to a block with reverse orientation, the RBC shall not issue the MA (for this signal). The signal shall be overridden with OVERRIDE.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2213

requirements.text: RBC 233 If a block signal is on stop due to failure of the interface between the stations (the case of BLAI), the RBC shall not issue MA (for this signal). The signal shall be overridden with OVERRIDE. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2215

requirements.text: RBC 234 If a block signal is on stop due to the fact that the CE installation is down or due to loss of communication between CE and the RBC, the RBC shall not issue MA (for this signal). The signal shall be overridden with OVERRIDE. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2217

requirements.text: RBC 235 If a block signal is on stop due to the fact that the CE installation is down or due to loss of communication between CE and the RBC, the RBC shall not issue MA (for this signal). The signal shall be overridden with OVERRIDE. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2219

requirements.text: RBC 236 In the case of mixed situations, the RBC must make the most restrictive decision (the most restrictive MA must be issued) and send the appropriate messages for mixed situations.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2221

requirements.text:
RBC 237 The RBC must not issue an MA for(LC):
-	a signal on stop displaying a call without a locked route
-	a signal on stop without displaying a call.
This applies even when the signal is on stop due to burnt out lamps.
requirements.title: TND_2223

requirements.text: RBC 238 The RBC must issue an MA OS for a signal on stop that displays call with locked route (CH1).(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2227

requirements.text: RBC 239 If an ITN fails after an MA passes over it, the signal switches to stop and that MA must be withdrawn/ cancelled. Unlocking the route must comply with the requirements in this document. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2228

requirements.text: RBC 240 BLAI case: The reaction that care must be obtained at the RBC, following the activation of the AFBLE/AFBLI function on the BLAI, in the adjacent CE installations A and B, both with an established connection to the RBC, is described in the following table(LC):
requirements.title: TND_2230

requirements.text: RBC 241 After using the commands described at points 1-11 above, the RBC shall issue the MA FS for the static speed profile, without exceeding 100km/h, starting with the station exit signal to the block that is out of commission (AFBLE active), and to the entrance signal to the neighboring station (AFBLI active). (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2233

requirements.text: RBC 242 If one of the adjacent stations A or B has a loss of connection with the RBC, the RBC must not issue an MA in any of them, even if the command AFBLE/AFBLE was executed in the CE with an active connection to the RBC. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2234

requirements.text: RBC 243 BLA/BLAS case: The reaction that must be obtained at the RBC, after activating the AFBL on the BLA/BLAS, in the adjacent CE/CED installations A and B, with station A having an established connection to the RBC, while station B is not included in the RBC, is described in the following table (LC):
requirements.title: TND_2236

requirements.text: RBC 244 After using the above AFBL command, the RBC shall issue an appropriate MA FS for the static speed profile, without exceeding 100km/h, starting with the exit signal from the station to the block that is out of commission (AFBL active), up to the exit from level 2 (BLA case) or the entry signal of the neighboring station (BLAS case).(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2238

requirements.text: RBC 245 The RBC system must allow information to be recorded on defective/missing balise groups. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2240

requirementParts.text:
MMI_ETCS
MMI_IXL
RBC
MMI_Traffic_Mgmt
OBU
Engineering_AT

requirements.text: RBC 246 If a train encounters a defective/missing balise group on the track, the reaction shall be “no reaction”. If two consecutive groups of defective/missing track balises are encountered, the reaction shall be “service break”. For both the above cases, the information on the missing/defective balises must be displayed on the CMI and the DMI.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2242

requirements.text: RBC 247 If a train connected to the RBC encounters a group with reversed balises, the reaction shall be “emergency braking”. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2243

requirements.text: RBC 248 The Tenderer’s offer must present quoted maintenance contract (on a yearly basis) that shall also include the list of spare parts, mean time between faults (MTBF) and the unit price per module. (O)
requirements.title: TND_2246

requirements.text: RBC 249 Conceptul de întreținere must să includă funcții care să susțină(LC):
requirements.title: TND_2247

requirements.text: RBC 250 The Tenderer’s offer shall include training courses for the CFR personnel to operate and maintain the system. The courses shall be distinct for the operation personnel and the maintenance personnel. The courses must be quoted distinctly.(O)
requirements.title: TND_2253

requirements.text: RBC 251 Training shall be organized for at least 2 series of 8-10 persons.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2254

requirements.text: RBC 252 For this project, preparing the data for the track configuration in the RBC shall be the Contractor’s responsibility. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2256
TND_2257

requirements.text: RBC 254 The manufacturer of the RBC must provide all the necessary information regarding the measures for the preventative maintenance of RBC equipment, such as inspection intervals, durability of hardware equipment, acquiring spare parts, etc.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2262

requirements.text: RBC 255 The diagnostics function must assist the maintenance personnel in identifying defective units when a fault occurs. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2264

requirements.text: RBC 256 The diagnostics function must assist the maintenance personnel in filtering diagnostic messages by type and date.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2265

requirements.text: RBC 257 The diagnostics function must allow diagnostic data to be exported locally and to the central server located in the OCC.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2266

requirements.text: RBC 258 The RBC must be fitted with a set of self-test functions. Such functions must include a test on startup and online tests during operation.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2268

requirements.text: RBC 259 The RBC must provide status and diagnostic messages for the RBC maintenance personnel in order to analyze any fault in the components and interfaces of the RBC. This must consider each hardware element in the RBC, also including the interfaces with the CE, OBU and GSM-R, relevant for the repair and replacement. Temporary faults and permanent faults must be shown to assist the maintenance personnel. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2269

requirements.text: RBC 260 After starting the RBC (for instance, after completing a repair), a fully automatic self-test must ensure that the operation of the RBC is safe.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2270

requirements.text:
RBC 261 The maintenance of the trackside ETCS equipment and GSM-R must be assisted by diagnostics for(LC):
-	faults in the balise groups (reading errors), reported by the OBU
-	GSM-R faults, frequency and location of dropped connections between RBC and OBU.
requirements.title: TND_2271

requirements.text: RBC 262 All messages provided by the RBC must be documented with detailed descriptions and necessary actions in a maintenance manual (LC).
requirements.title: TND_2274

requirements.text: RBC 263 Critical diagnostic messages must be displayed accompanied by a sound alarm.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2276

requirements.text: RBC 264 Acknowledging a sound alarm must cause the sound alarm to be muted. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2277

requirements.text: RBC 265 When the conditions that generated an alarm disappear, the alarm status must change until acknowledgment by the controller, at which time it shall be removed from the screen.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2278

requirements.text: RBC 266 The maintenance function must include sub-functions for providing detailed information regarding the system and its interfaces, as well as real-time status. The Contractor must present CFR its proposal for a maintenance tool. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2280

requirements.text: RBC 267 The RBC must include a function for recording legal data and the necessary data for system diagnostics and playback.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2282

requirements.text: RBC 268 The recording function must save at least the following data(LC):
requirements.title: TND_2283

requirements.text: RBC 269 All saved data must have a time and date associated.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2290

requirements.text: RBC 270 Recorded data must be stored in memory for at least six months.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2291

requirements.text: RBC 271 The RBC must store all the legal data in a secure manner so that any data tampering and/or errors may be detected. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2292

requirements.text: RBC 272 The maintenance tool “recording function” must include functions for the analysis of recorded data, allowing recorded data to be filtered to have an efficient evaluation of the diagnostic data and for legal purposes.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2293

requirements.text:
RBC 273 The analysis tool must provide at least the following (LC):
-	Displaying specific data from the legal recorder
-	Downloading data from the legal recorder
requirements.title: TND_2294

requirements.text: RBC 274 The information must be presented so that it is easily understood and sufficient, so that the user understands the tasks to be performed. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2299

requirements.text: RBC 275 The CMI must be physically distinct from the human-machine interface for the CE or CTC installations.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2300

requirements.text: RBC 276 All text information displayed on the CMI must be in Romanian.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2301

requirements.text: RBC 277 Each data input from the user must cause audio and/or visual feedback to confirm that the action was properly recognized. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2302

requirements.text: RBC 278 During the detailed design, it must be possible to choose the types of sounds to be used and the times when such sounds must be used. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2303

requirements.text: RBC 279 The information that require the user’s attention must be presented as to warn the user of such situation. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2304

requirements.text: RBC 280 Critical messages must have a visual and sound component. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2305

requirements.text: RBC 281 The user must be able to recognize at a glance the system status and the supervision status. Running directions must be labelled on the CMI.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2306

requirements.text: RBC 282 The user must be able to easily identify the status from which the display is frozen. The entire chain must be supervised, from the object to track configuration.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2307

requirements.text: RBC 283 The RBC must indicate to the user that it is busy when the result of the user action cannot be displayed immediately. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2308

requirements.text: RBC 284 The indication “ready” must only be displayed to the user when the action requested by the user from the RBC has been executed. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2309

requirements.text: RBC 285 The request for acknowledgment must be clearly displayed to the user. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2310

requirements.text: RBC 286 The CMI must provide means for acknowledgment. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2311

requirements.text: RBC 287 The CMI must provide means for consultation and data input. These must be easy to understand for the user. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2312

requirements.text: RBC 288 The sound unit must be able to produce a variety of sounds. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2313

requirements.text: RBC 289 The user must not have the possibility to adjust the sound volume. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2314

requirements.text: RBC 290 Different sounds must be easy to distinguish and recognize for the user. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2315

requirements.text: RBC 291 The CMI must display the operational unit under the controller’s command.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2316

requirements.text: RBC 292 All trains under the supervision of the RBC must be displayed at the same time on the track configuration and in a table identifying the train supervision status. Additionally, the table of speed restrictions entered in the RBC must be displayed at all times. If all this information does not fit on a single monitor, it is allowed to display train supervision information on separate monitors. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2317

requirements.text: RBC 293 The MA sent to the train must be represented on the track configuration.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2318

requirements.text: RBC 294 The MA must be shown continuously in graphic form and upon the controller’s request in table format.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2319

requirements.text: RBC 295 Indications regarding the RBC statuses must cover at least the following statuses(LC):
requirements.title: TND_2320

requirements.text: RBC 296 It must be possible to define the number and details regarding the information shown on the CMI. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2323

requirements.text: RBC 297 The Controller must be able to enter and remove speed restrictions (TSR), stop a certain train and authorize/withdraw the authorization of the RBC to issue MAs to recorded trains.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2326

requirements.text: RBC 298 The system engineer must have unrestricted access to the RBC.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2328

requirements.text: RBC 299 Access of the maintenance personnel to the track must be restricted to maintenance functions and such access must occur under the authority of the controller. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2330

requirements.text: RBC 300 A workstation must be equipped with at least 32-inch graphic displays, keyboard, mouse, and any other equipment required for the controller’s activity. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2333

requirements.text: RBC 301 The RBC must be able to display the fact that a train has received an emergency stop message (when the OBU sends this acknowledgment to the RBC).(LC).
requirements.title: TND_2334
TND_2336

requirements.text: RBC 303 The basic colors for displaying the status of the objects must be compliant with the CMI Symbol Catalog v.1.3.2. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2340

requirements.text: RBC 304 It must be possible to place an object anywhere in the track configuration. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2341

requirements.text: RBC 305 During detailed design it must be possible to define available commands when selecting a specific object.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2342

requirements.text: RBC 306 Tracks and objects in the RBC area and announcement/transition zones (signals, balises, etc.) must be represented on the CMI.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2343

requirements.text: RBC 307 Error messages must be displayed whether the faulty object is displayed on the screen at the time or not. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2344

requirements.text: RBC 308 The Controller must be able to add and remove texts from a section, for instance to identify any vehicle on that section. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2345

requirements.text: RBC 309 It must be possible to predefine user groups. At least three user groups shall be defined: RBC operator, administrator, RBC observer.
requirements.title: TND_2348

requirements.text: RBC 310 It must be possible for each user to belong to several user groups. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2352

requirements.text: RBC 311 It must be possible for each user group to contain several users. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2353

requirements.text: RBC 312 Credentials must be checked as a login procedure based on a user account and password. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2355

requirements.text: RBC 313 For each user group, it must be possible to define functions and information to which that group has access.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2356

requirements.text: RBC 314 For each workstation it must be possible to define user groups that have the permission to operate that workstation.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2357

requirements.text: RBC 315 For safety reasons, the user must not have permission to change display settings.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2358

requirements.text: RBC 316 A specific alarm and its status must be displayed on the monitor in a convenient manner. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2360

requirements.text: RBC 317 If an alarm is not allocated to a certain position, it must be shown as a text message.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2361

requirements.text: RBC 318 All active alarms must be presented as an alarm list, which can be displayed on request. Additionally, after being acknowledged by the RBC operator and corrected by the maintenance personnel, they must remain displayed in an alarm history, which must be displayed on the CMI and at the maintenance station. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2362

requirements.text: RBC 319 This project does not provide for special functions (such as TSR enabling/disabling) for portable devices. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2364

requirements.text: RBC 320 All acceptance tests for the ETCS level 2 system shall check the content of the telegrams emitted/received by the RBC and the balises.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2366

requirements.text: RBC 321 Declaration of conformity. As part of the tests, the Integrator must provide the technical possibility to actually read the content of the telegrams emitted/received by the RBC and the balises, for any situation that is possible in the project. In this case, CFR requires a declaration that guarantees the possibility to actually read the telegrams during testing and the tenderer presenting the software that will be delivered according to requirementbookmark77(O)
requirements.title: TND_2367

requirements.text: RBC 322 Testing. This service involves the physical installation of the equipment supplied by the tenderer in each location. (I)
requirements.title: TND_2369

requirements.text: RBC 323 The Tenderer must ensure supervision for the installation and commissioning. Upon the first installation (first site) the tenderer shall make a proposal for the acceptance model, which proposal must be submitted to CFR for approval. All subsequent installations must be done according to the model approved by CFR.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2370

requirements.text: RBC 324 After each installation, the tenderer must produce a file containing the most important documents for the installed equipment. The file shall contain wiring and installation plans and the settings that were used. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2371

requirements.text: RBC 325 CFR personnel must participate in each installation and commissioning.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2372

requirements.text: RBC 326 FAT (Factory Acceptance Tests). During the FAT, the tenderer has the obligation to test all the individual elements, units and parts of the system in order to prove full compliance with the specifications of the provided documents. The Client has the right to participate in all FAT done by the supplier. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2375

requirements.text: RBC 327 Tests on installation. The tests performed on installation are done to ensure the integrity of the equipment after delivery and installation. Additionally, such tests validate the hardware configuration, the integration of the RBC - CE - GSM-R systems and the fact that the installation meets the specifications. The Tenderer shall be responsible for the testing procedure for all the equipment of the RBC system.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2376

requirements.text: RBC 328 The Contractor shall perform functional integration tests of the end-to-end integrated system before inviting CFR for tests. They shall request CFR tests to start only if their own tests have been successfully completed and the positive result shall be presented to the Client by submitting the internal check file showing the tests that were performed and the results that were obtained, at least one month prior to starting the CFR tests.(LC)
requirements.title: TND_2378

PM_ERTMS
Test_Integration
Engineering_RO
Bid_Manager
PM
Engineering_AT
Commissioning

requirements.text: RBC 329 The Tenderer shall submit as part of the offer the plan to test fulfilment of all RBC requirements in this document, with a summary description of the testing situations. The testing plan shall include both the tests to be performed in the laboratory with a train movement simulator, and dynamic tests to be performed in the field, with the test train. For this, the Tenderer shall present a conformity matrix in which each requirement shall be presented and the manner of achievement and testing by the Tenderer shall be explained, both in the laboratory and the field, and the sequence of tests.(O)
requirements.title: TND_2379

requirements.text: RBC 330 The Contractor shall make available, throughout the contract term (during the functioning of the Technical Verification Panel from CFR) a simulator for the OBU, which would provide all the information displayed on the DMI aboard the engine. This shall be connected to the RBC installed in the project or to a different RBC, installed at another location, which shall be made available to the CFR Technical Verification Panel for testing. If an RBC at a different location is used, it must be of the same type with the one supplied under the project and run the same software version, have the same configuration, and the necessary information must be provided by simulators/real CE equipment that run the same software as the CE installations in the project. The Contractor provide assistance to CFR personnel to operate the simulators, throughout the contract term (during the functioning of the Technical Verification Panel from CFR) (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2380

requirements.text: RBC 331 When performing dynamic engine tests  prior to the commissioning of the CE installations, the Contractor shall ensure the necessary personnel from the section models of the track circuits, matching the train movement. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2381

requirements.text: RBC 332 During the performance of the tests presented in the tender, at pointbookmark175 if CFR representatives find that the test proposed by the Contractor is inconclusive to prove full compliance with a requirement, CFR may request the Contractor to supplement with additional tests at no extra cost. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2382

requirements.text:
RBC 333 Providing the test train with the respective personnel for the integration and acceptance tests for the ERTMS level 2 system, under dynamic status, is mandatory and is the exclusive duty of the Contractor.
The test train must be provided for the entire duration of the dynamic testing, to prove compliance with all the requirements, and to check the correction of any non-compliance. (LC)
requirements.title: TND_2383

requirements.text: RBC diagnostic testing;

requirements.text: RBC 336 The Contractor shall present all the values used for the rest of the variables defined in chapter 7.5 of SUBSET 026.(LC)
